intro: Delissea subcordata subsp. subcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed delissea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
